text: Any idea why I can only save this PNG as a WebP?
<https://www.intechinvestments.com/hubfs/Intech-Default_Card_Background.png>
access it in edge or FF
HS has it coded so it shows as webp in chrome
images hosted on HS will go webp in browsers that support webp. though I thought that only applied to ones that have query params
when I viewed the image it let me save as png(uploaded above)
Interesting, that makes it a bear to save out but I guess that doesn’t happen often.
doesnt happen often and there are plugins available to let you convert the webp to png/jpg on save
im constantly using conversion services since I basically am only able to download webp files now where ever I go. It's honestly extremely frustrating
well in browser’s defense, if more OS’s just natively supported webp then there wouldn’t be an issue. most people would be happy with the format
Yep especially with the speed benefits
I feel like Google got lazy on their doodle logo commemorating George H. W. Bush. feel like they could have just changed it to say “George” instead of Google and it’d look better
It’s just a gray Google for me…
thats exactly it Pete

```Google has replaced its normally colorful logo with a charcoal gray-colored one on the National Day of Mourning for former President George H. W. Bush, whose state funeral is Wednesday. Under the search and infamous "I'm Feeling Lucky" button is a line of text that simply reads: "President George H. W. Bush, 1924 - 2018."```
I feel like they got lazy in comparison to other people dying. just saying
Yeah it didn’t even register with me that it was different
heck if they had just a flag at half staff next to the word Google and just recycled it when a US politician/general/something died it’d seem like they did more
they should of done something like this:
lol
